intro: Hieracium acrogymnon, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellowish to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. It has basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy, with stems that are often reddish in color. Hieracium acrogymnon is a perennial species that can spread through both seeds and rhizomes, making it a common weed in agricultural and natural areas.
